<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">

<tr valign="top" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left;">
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 45pt">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font color="black" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;</font><!--EFPlaceholder--><font color="black" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">Item 9A</font></font></div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><!--EFPlaceholder--><font color="black" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">Controls and Procedures&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 22</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left;">
<td style="WIDTH: 45pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font color="black" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;</font><!--EFPlaceholder--><font color="black" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">Item 9B</font></font></div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><!--EFPlaceholder--><font color="black" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; </td>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></font></div>

<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 13pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">PART I</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Cautionary Statement with Respect to Forward-Looking Statements</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>This annual report on Form 10-K contains statements that are forward-looking.&#160;&#160;We caution that words used in this document such as &#8220;expects,&#8221; &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;may,&#8221; and &#8220;optimistic,&#8221; as well as similar words and expressions used herein, identify and refer to statements describing events that may or may not occur in the future.&#160;&#160;These forward-looking statements and the matters to which they refer are subject to considerable uncertainty that may cause actual results to be materially different from those described herein.&#160;&#160;There are numerous factors that could cause actual results to be different than those anticipated or predicted by us, including:&#160;&#160;(i) a deterioration in economic conditions in general;&#160;&#160;(ii) a decrease in demand for our products or services in particular;&#160;&#160;(iii) our loss of a key employee or employees;&#160;&#160;(iv) regulatory changes, including changes in environmental regulations, that may have an adverse affect on the demand for our products or services;&#160;&#160;(v) increases in our operating expenses resulting from increased costs of labor and/or consulting services; (vi) our inability to exploit existing or secure additional sources of revenues or capital to fund operations; (vii) a failure to collect upon or otherwise secure the benefits of existing contractual commitments with third parties, including our customers; and (viii) other factors and risks identified in this Form 10-K, including under the caption "Risk Factors."&#160;&#160;This list provides examples of factors that could affect the results described by forward-looking statements contained in this Form 10-K; however, this list is not exhaustive. Many other factors could impact our business and it is impossible to predict with any accuracy which factors could result in negative impacts.&#160;&#160;Although we believe that the forward-looking statements contained in this Form 10-K are reasonable, we cannot provide you with any guarantee that the anticipated results will not be adverse and that the anticipated results will be achieved.&#160;&#160;All forward-looking statements in this Form 10-K are expressly qualified in their entirety by the cautionary statements contained in this section and you are cautioned not to place undue reliance on the forward-looking statements contained in this Form 10-K.&#160;&#160;In addition to the risks listed above, other risks may arise in the future, and we disclaim any obligation to update information contained in any forward-looking statement.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item 1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Business</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">General</font></font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We were incorporated in Delaware in April 1993, and became a public company in October 1993.&#160;&#160;We own and sometimes license various N-Viro processes and patented technologies to treat and recycle wastewater and other bio-organic wastes, utilizing certain alkaline and mineral by-products produced by the cement, lime, electrical generation and other industries.&#160;&#160;To date, the N-Viro Process has been commercially utilized for the recycling of wastewater sludge from municipal wastewater treatment facilities.&#160;&#160;All N-Viro products produced according to the N-Viro Process specifications, are "exceptional quality" sludge products under the 40 CFR Part 503 Sludge Regulations promulgated under the Clean Water Act of 1987 (the "Part 503 Regs").</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our current business strategy is to market our N-Viro Fuel<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">TM</font> technology, which produces a renewable alternative fuel product out of certain bio-organic wastes.&#160;&#160;This N-Viro Fuel process has been acknowledged by the USEPA as a fuel product that can be used to produce alternative energy.&#160;&#160;In this business strategy, the primary focus is to identify allies, public and private, which will allow the opportunity for N-Viro to build, own and operate N-Viro Fuel facilities either on its own or in concert with others.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In 2011, we operated two biosolids processing facilities located in Toledo, Ohio and Volusia County, Florida.&#160;&#160;These two facilities each produce the N-Viro Soil<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">TM</font> agricultural product, and have provided us with working and development capital.&#160;&#160;In late 2011 we effectively ceased operations at the Toledo facility, and our goal is to continue to operate thethe Florida facility and aggressively market our N-Viro Fuel technology.&#160;&#160;These patented processes are best suited for current and future demands, satisfying both waste treatment needs as well as domestic and international directives for clean, renewable alternative fuel sources.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">The N-Viro Process</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The N-Viro Soil Process involves mixing wastewater residuals (sludge) with an alkaline admixture and then subjecting the mixture to a controlled period of storage, mechanical turning and accelerated drying.&#160;&#160;The N-Viro Process stabilizes and pasteurizes the wastewater residuals, reduces odors to acceptable levels, neutralizes or immobilizes various constituents and generates N-Viro Soil&#8482;, a product which has a granular appearance similar to soil and has multiple agricultural uses.&#160;&#160;N-Viro and its licensees have successfully marketed and distributed all N-Viro Soil product produced for beneficial reuse.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The alkaline products used in all N-Viro Processes consist of by-products from the cement or lime industry and certain fly ashes from coal-fired systems used in electric power generation.&#160;&#160;The particular admixture that is used usually depends upon economics and availability in local markets.&#160;&#160;We are a distributor of alkaline admixtures for others.&#160;&#160;We also work with established by-product marketers to identify and utilize available materials.&#160;&#160;We generally charge a mark-up over our cost for alkaline admixtures sold to third parties.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our original N-Viro Process was enhanced in the 1990&#8217;s with the addition of advanced mechanical drying known as the N-Viro BioDry process.&#160;&#160;BioDry had been successfully implemented in five plants operating in Canada.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">N-Viro Fuel<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">TM</font></font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>N-Viro Fuel&#8482; is a relatively new and patented biomass alternative energy fuel process that produces a product that has physical and chemical characteristics similar to certain coals and is created from municipal biosolids, collectable animal manure, pulp and paper sludge and possibly other organic wastes.&#160;&#160;N-Viro Fuel is manufactured by blending the waste material(s) with one or more alkaline products, followed by thorough drying of the mixture using a thermal evaporative process.&#160;&#160;The resulting product can be easily blended with coal, waste coal, petroleum coke and/or other biomass-type fuels, and burned as a partial fuel substitute in combustion power plants.&#160;&#160;N-Viro Fuel has satisfied initial guidelines set forth by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to qualify as an alternative energy source that may be utilized in commercial power generation subject to state permitting.&#160;&#160;The N-Viro Fuel technology, utilizing an alkaline/heat process to produce a fuel product, still satisfies all requirements of the USEPA 40 CFR part 503 regulations and is a safe product usable for agriculture as well as for energy production.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our N-Viro Fuel technology can convert waste products presently being landfilled or land applied into safe, beneficial and renewable long-term energy solutions as part of a renewable-energy economy.&#160;&#160;Attaining and maintaining this status means that N-Viro Fuel technology is now a likely candidate to qualify for certain economic incentives that may be granted to alternative energy technologies, and a catalyst for obtaining permits more efficiently in each state.&#160;&#160;We plan to accelerate our development efforts as this designation is an important factor for our potential energy partners.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">N-Viro Process Facilities</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our first N-Viro processing facility was located in Toledo, Ohio and was managed by us through a contract management agreement with the City of Toledo since our inception through November 2011.&#160;&#160;Revenue generated from and related to the Toledo operation accounted for about 17% of our total revenue in 2011.&#160;&#160;Under this contract, we processed Toledo's wastewater biosolids and sold the resulting N-Viro Soil product to the agricultural market throughout Northwest Ohio.&#160;&#160;The contract we operated under during most of 2011 had been extended several times, including 2004, 2009, and twice in 2010.&#160;&#160;The current extension scheduled to conclude in September 2011 was officially not renewed in October 2011, and we ceased taking Toledo&#8217;s sludge in November 2011, at the end of our twenty-second year of operation.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Florida N-Viro, LP, a wholly-owned subsidiary we fully acquired effective January 1, 2007, has been in continuous operation since 1995 in Florida.&#160;&#160;The Florida facility is located in Volusia County and presently processes regional biosolids for multiple communities and maintains contracts with the City of Altamonte Springs, the City of Oviedo, the City of Palm Coast, the City of Port Orange, the Tohopekaliga Water Authority and Volusia County.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the company works with other regional biosolids management companies and has worked with other municipalities with short-term and interim agreements.&#160;&#160;In December 2011, we received notice from Seminole County they were terminating their agreement for wastewater residuals processing at our Florida facility, effective January 2012.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Florida N-Viro derives revenue from several sources.&#160;&#160;Each municipal customer compensates N-Viro for the processing of their waste materials.&#160;&#160;Florida N-Viro also receives revenue from utilizing the alkaline products produced by regional power utilities, including Cedar Bay Generating, thru a supply agreement with Headwaters Corporation and Jacksonville Electric Authority.&#160;&#160;We have also been successful in marketing our N-Viro Soil to local agricultural markets.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our Volusia County facility operates under and is regulated by a permit issued by the Florida Department of Environmental Protection.&#160;&#160;We believe we have a satisfactory operating history and positive relationship with the regulatory agencies.&#160;&#160;We lease the processing facility from Volusia County and renewed our five year contract and lease agreement for the third time in 2010.&#160;&#160;Florida N-Viro represented 79% of our total revenue in 2011, and this percentage and total revenues have been escalating using N-Viro&#8217;s regional processing model.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Sales and Marketing of N-Viro Process</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We market our technologies principally through internal sales efforts.&#160;&#160;All domestic sales and marketing are controlled by management.&#160;&#160;The primary focus of our marketing efforts is towards the full commercialization of our N-Viro Fuel&#8482; technologies.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The N-Viro Fuel market requires us to work within two different and unique regulatory segments.&#160;&#160;First, our N-Viro Fuel facilities must satisfy biosolids permit requirements for the 40 CFR Part 503 regulations.&#160;&#160;Second, the finished fuel product must comply with each individual power generator&#8217;s emission permit requirements.&#160;&#160;To accomplish this requirement to satisfy air permitting in the power generation facilities, N-Viro has procured, permitted, constructed and has operated a mobile facility to produce N-Viro Fuel on a commercial full-scale basis.&#160;&#160;We will continue to use this facility to demonstrate the effectiveness of our process at discrete locations with the purpose of meeting the requirements necessary to ultimately permit, build, own and operate permanent N-Viro Fuel processing facilities.&#160;&#160;We can provide no assurance in our ability to negotiate long-term arrangements from the mobile facility&#8217;s performance.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">International Sales And Marketing</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In certain countries outside the United States, we sell or license the N-Viro Process through agents.&#160;&#160;In their respective territories, the agents market licenses for the N-Viro Processes, serve as distributors of alkaline admixture, oversee quality control of the installed N-Viro facilities, enforce the terms of the license agreements with licensees and market N-Viro Soil.&#160;&#160;In general, the agents have paid one-time, up-front fees to us for the rights to market or use the N-Viro Process in their respective territories.&#160;&#160;Typically, the agreements with the agents provide for us to receive a portion of the up-front license fees, ongoing royalty fees paid by the licensees, a portion of the proceeds from the distribution and resale of alkaline admixture and the sale of N-Viro Soil.&#160;&#160;Agents have total responsibility and control over the marketing and contracts for N-Viro technology, subject only to license models or minimum agreements with us.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The following table sets forth our Agent and the territorial rights of that Agent:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 91.6pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Agent</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Territory</font><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt; COLOR: black">&#160;</font></font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; CRM Technologies&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Israel, Greece and Eastern Europe</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Earnings Variation Due to Business Cycles and Seasonal Factors</font>.&#160;&#160;Our operating results can experience quarterly or annual variations due to business cycles, seasonality and other factors.&#160;&#160;During the last fiscal quarter of 2011, approximately 98% of our revenue was from management-run operations, 2% from other domestic third party agreements and 0% from foreign agreements or research and development grants.&#160;&#160;Sales of the N-Viro technology are affected by general fluctuations in the business cycles in the United States and worldwide, instability of economic conditions and interest rates, as well as other factors.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Risks of Doing Business in Other Countries</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">.&#160;&#160;We conduct a very small amount of business in markets outside the United States, and expect to continue to do so.&#160;&#160;In addition to the risk of currency fluctuations, the risks associated with conducting business outside the United States include: social, political and economic instability; slower payment of invoices; underdeveloped infrastructure; underdeveloped legal systems; and nationalization.&#160;&#160;We have not entered into any currency swap agreements which may reduce these risks.&#160;&#160;We may enter into such agreements in the future if it is deemed necessary to do so.&#160;&#160;We cannot predict the full impact of this economic instability, but it could have a material adverse effect on revenues and profits.</font></font></div>

<div><br>
<br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Research and Development</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We continue to investigate methods to shorten drying time, improve the N-Viro Fuel process, substitute various other materials for use as alkaline admixtures and improve the quality and attractiveness of N-Viro Fuel to a variety of end-users.&#160;&#160;We see opportunities to improve the efficiency of our process through the utilization of alterative heat sources such as methane, waste heat solid fuel and gasification technologies, as viable alternatives to the use of natural gas for process drying.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In 2007 we performed a full scale test of the N-Viro Fuel product at the T.B. Simon Power Plant located on the campus of Michigan State University.&#160;&#160;The successful results of this first full test encouraged us to focus primarily on the development of the N-Viro Fuel technology.&#160;&#160;In September 2011, we performed a multiple day 10% N-Viro Fuel test with a Pennsylvania power producer, utilizing our mobile facility for the production of the test fuel.&#160;&#160;This test was successful as it demonstrated that N-Viro Fuel had no adverse effects on the boiler operation, no negative impacts on resulting ash and no exceedences in stack air emissions.&#160;&#160;This successful test is expected to be followed by a 20% test with full stack monitoring to allow for full permitting at that site for the use of N-Viro Fuel.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Patents and Proprietary Rights</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We have several patents and licenses relating to the treatment and processing of biosolids.&#160;&#160;While there is no one single patent that is alone material to our business, we believe that our aggregate patents are important to our prospects for future success.&#160;&#160;However, we cannot be certain that future patent applications will successfully be issued as patents, or that any already issued patents will give us a competitive advantage.&#160;&#160;It is also possible that our patents could be successfully challenged or circumvented by competitors or other parties.&#160;&#160;In addition, we cannot assure that our treatment processes do not infringe on patents held by third-parties or their proprietary rights.&#160;&#160;We are aware of no such infringement, however.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We hold several patents relating to N-Viro Fuel.&#160;&#160;In the N-Viro Fuel process, waste products, which can include domestic sewage sludge, manures and other materials, are treated with mineral by-products, dried by a mechanical dryer, and converted into a renewable fuel that can be used as a substitute for coal in coal-fired boilers and kilns.&#160;&#160;We are actively marketing the N-Viro Fuel process in response to the national policy encouraging both alternative energy generation as well as attaining the highest and best reuse of waste materials.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Some early N-Viro patents were developed jointly with the former Medical College of Ohio, now under the name of the University of Toledo ("UT").&#160;&#160;Because of the joint development of early N-Viro patents with UT, we agreed the licensing of these early patents would generate a royalty payable by us to UT.&#160;&#160;We also agreed with UT that claims to the traditional N-Viro Soil process was one-quarter of one percent (1/4%) of technical revenues until expiration of those patents.&#160;&#160;UT rights to BioBlend and certain other N-Viro technologies range from 2% to 4% of technical revenues derived from these newer technologies.&#160;&#160;Cumulative royalties paid to UT through December 31, 2011 were approximately $65,000, and no amount was expensed during any of the years 2008 through 2011.&#160;&#160;UT has no claim to the N-Viro Fuel technologies or process.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In addition, we make use of our trade secrets or "know-how" developed in the course of our experience in the marketing of our services.&#160;&#160;To the extent that we rely upon trade secrets, unpatented know-how and the development of improvements in establishing and maintaining a competitive advantage in the market for our services, we can provide no assurance that such proprietary technology will remain a trade secret or that others will not develop substantially equivalent or superior technologies to compete with our services.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Industry Overview</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Under the Part 503 Regulations, landfills, surface disposal and incineration remain permissible sludge management alternatives.&#160;&#160;However, these conventional disposal options have become subject to more stringent regulatory standards.&#160;&#160;The vast majority of states have enacted site restrictions and/or other management practices governing the disposal of sludge in landfills or surface disposal.&#160;&#160;Amendments to the Clean Air Act governing incineration and disposal of residual ash also impose stricter air emission standards for incineration in general, and the Part 503 Regulations impose additional specific pollutant limits for sludge to be incinerated and for the resulting air emissions.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Surface disposal of sludge involves the placement of sludge on the land, often at a dedicated site for disposal purposes.&#160;&#160;The Part 503 Regulations subject surface disposal to increased regulation by requiring, among other things, run-off and leachate collection systems, methane monitoring systems and monitoring of, and limits on, pollutant levels.&#160;&#160;In addition, sludge placed in a surface disposal site are often required to meet certain standards with respect to pathogen levels relating to coliform or salmonella bacteria counts ("Class B" pathogen levels), levels of various pollutants, including metals, and elimination of attractiveness to pests, such as insects and rodents.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Land application for beneficial use involves the application of sludge or sludge-based products, for non-disposal purposes, including agricultural, silvicultural and horticultural uses and for land reclamation.&#160;&#160;Under the Part 503 Regulations, N-Viro Soil is a product that meets certain stringent standards.&#160;&#160;"Class A" pathogen levels&#8221;, levels of various pollutants, including metals, and elimination of attractiveness to pests, such as insects and rodents, are considered by the EPA to be "exceptional quality" products.&#160;&#160;The Class A pathogen levels are significantly more stringent than the Class B pathogen levels.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>"Exceptional quality" products are treated by the USEPA as safe products, thereby exempting these products from many federal restrictions on their use.&#160;&#160;All N-Viro products that are produced according to N-Viro Process specifications meet the pollutant concentration limits and other standards set forth in the Part 503 Regulations, and therefore qualify as an "exceptional quality" product that exceeds the USEPA's standards for unrestricted use.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Competition</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We are in direct and indirect competition with other businesses, including disposal and other wastewater sludge treatment businesses, some of which are larger and more firmly established and may have greater marketing and development budgets and capital resources than us.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that we will be able to maintain a competitive position in the sludge treatment industry.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We compete against companies in a highly competitive market and have fewer resources than many of those companies.&#160;&#160;Our business competes within and outside the United States principally on the basis of pricing, reliability of our services provided, product quality, specifications and technical support.&#160;&#160;Competitive pressures and other factors could cause us to lose market share or could result in decreases in prices, either of which could have a material adverse effect on our financial position and results of operation.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Environmental Regulation</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Various environmental protection laws have been enacted and amended during recent decades in response to public concern over the environment.&#160;&#160;Our operations and those of our licensees are subject to these evolving laws and the implementing regulations.&#160;&#160;The primary United States environmental laws which we believe may be applicable to the N-Viro Process and the land application of N-Viro Soil<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">TM</font> include Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (&#8220;RCRA&#8221;), the Federal Water Pollution Control Act of 1972 (&#8220;Clean Water Act&#8221;), the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act, (&#8220;CERCLA&#8221;) and the Pollution Prevention Act of 1990 (&#8220;PPA&#8221;).&#160;&#160;These laws regulate the management and disposal of wastes, control the discharge of pollutants into the water, provide for the investigation and remediation of contaminated land and groundwater resources and establish a pollution prevention program.&#160;&#160;In addition, various states have implemented environmental protection laws that are similar to the applicable federal laws.&#160;&#160;States also may require, among other things, permits to construct N-Viro facilities and to sell and/or use N-Viro Soil<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">TM</font>.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that any such permits will be issued.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">The Part 503 Regulations</font>.&#160;&#160;Historically, sludge management has involved either disposal, principally by landfilling, incineration, ocean dumping and surface disposal, or land application for beneficial use.&#160;&#160;Sewage sludge and the use and disposal thereof are regulated under the Clean Water Act.&#160;&#160;In 1993, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (&#8220;EPA&#8221;) published the Part 503 Regulations under the Clean Water Act, implementing the EPA's "exceptional quality" program.&#160;&#160;These regulations establish sludge use and disposal standards applicable to public and privately-owned wastewater treatment plants in the United States, including publicly-owned treatment works, or POTWs.&#160;&#160;Under the Part 503 Regs, sludge products that meet certain stringent standards are considered to be "exceptional quality" (&#8220;Class A&#8221;) products and are not subject to any federal restrictions on agricultural use or land application.&#160;&#160;N-Viro Soil&#8482; is an "exceptional quality" product.&#160;&#160;Lower quality sludge products are subject to federal restrictions governing, among other items, the type and location of application, the volume of application and the cumulative application levels for certain pollutants.&#160;&#160;Agricultural application of these lower quality sludges in bulk amounts also requires an EPA permit.&#160;&#160;Agricultural and land applications of all sludge and sludge products, including N-Viro Soil&#8482; and other "exceptional quality" products, are typically subject to state and local regulation and, in most cases, require a permit.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In order to ensure compliance with the Part 503 Regs, we review the results of regular testing of sludge required by the EPA to be conducted by wastewater treatment plants, and it tests N-Viro Soil&#8482; produced at N-Viro facilities on a regular basis.&#160;&#160;In general, we do not license or permit the ongoing use of the N-Viro Process to treat any sludge that may not be processed into an "exceptional quality" sludge product.&#160;&#160;Although N-Viro Soil&#8482; exceeds the current federal standards imposed by the EPA for unrestricted agricultural use and land application, state and local authorities are authorized under the Clean Water Act to impose more stringent requirements than those promulgated by the EPA.&#160;&#160;Most states require permits for land application of sludge and sludge based products and several states have regulations for certain pollutants that impose more stringent numerical concentration limits than the federal rules.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">The Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.</font>&#160;&#160;RCRA regulates all phases of hazardous waste generation, management and disposal.&#160;&#160;Waste is subject to regulation as a hazardous waste under RCRA if it is a solid waste specifically listed as a hazardous waste by the EPA or exhibits a defined hazardous characteristic.&#160;&#160;Although domestic sewage and mixtures of domestic sewage and other wastes that pass through a sewer system to a POTW are specifically exempted from the definition of solid waste, once treated by the POTW, the sewage sludge is considered a solid waste.&#160;&#160;Although neither the alkaline admixture nor wastewater sludge used in the N-Viro Process are regulated as hazardous waste under RCRA, states may impose restrictions that are more stringent than federal regulations.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the raw materials used in the N-Viro Process may be regulated under some state hazardous waste laws as "special wastes," in which case specific storage and record keeping requirements may apply.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act of 1980</font>.&#160;&#160;CERCLA imposes strict, joint and several liability upon owners and operators of facilities where a release of hazardous substances has occurred, upon parties who generated hazardous substances into the environment that were released at such facilities and upon parties who arranged for the transportation of hazardous substances to such facilities.&#160;&#160;We believe the N-Viro Process poses little risk of releasing hazardous substances into the environment that presently could result in liability under CERCLA.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Other Environmental Laws</font>.&#160;&#160;The Pollution Prevention Act of 1990 establishes pollution prevention as a national objective, naming it a primary goal wherever feasible.&#160;&#160;The act states that where pollution cannot be prevented, materials should be recycled in an environmentally safe manner.&#160;&#160;Additional laws or regulations impacting use or negatively classifiying products like those produced by N-Viro are also a possibility.&#160;&#160;We believe that the N-Viro Process contributes to pollution prevention by providing an alternative to disposal.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">State Regulations</font>.&#160;&#160;State regulations typically require an N-Viro facility to obtain a permit for the sale of N-Viro Soil&#8482; for agricultural use, and may require a site-specific permit by the user of N-Viro Soil&#8482;.&#160;&#160;In addition, in some jurisdictions, state and/or local authorities have imposed permit requirements for, or have prohibited, the land application or agricultural use of sludge products, including "exceptional quality" sludge products.&#160;&#160;Certain of our licensees operate in jurisdictions that require permits and have been able to obtain them for the N-Viro product.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that any such permits will be issued or that any further attempts to require permits for, or to prohibit, the land application or agricultural use of sludge products will not be successful.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In addition, many states enforce landfill restrictions for non-hazardous sludge.&#160;&#160;These regulations typically require a permit to sell or use sludge products as landfill cover material.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that N-Viro facilities or landfill operators will be able to obtain required permits.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Environmental impact studies may be required in connection with the development of future N-Viro facilities.&#160;&#160;Such studies are generally time consuming and may create delays in the construction process.&#160;&#160;In addition, unfavorable conclusions reached in connection with such a study could result in termination of or expensive alterations to the N-Viro facility being developed.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The costs of compliance are typically borne by our licensees, except in the case of direct sludge processing into a facility.&#160;&#160;Normally this cost is not material to us in relation to the total contract revenue.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Employees</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As of December 31, 2011, we had 28 employees.&#160;&#160;Five of our employees were engaged in sales and marketing; three were in finance and administration and twenty were in operations.&#160;&#160;We consider our relationship with our employees to be satisfactory.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Throughout 2011 we were a party to a collective bargaining agreement (the "Labor Agreement") covering three employees of National N-Viro Tech, Inc., our wholly-owned subsidiary.&#160;&#160;The employees that were covered by the Labor Agreement worked at the Toledo, Ohio N-Viro facility, which was operated by us for the City of Toledo on a contract management basis and was terminated at the end of 2011.&#160;&#160;See Part I, &#8220;N-Viro Process Facilities&#8221; for additional explanation.&#160;&#160;These employees were members of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehouseman and Helpers Local Union No. 20, and we consider our relationship with the organization to be satisfactory.&#160;&#160;As of the filing of this Form 10-K, we no longer have any employees of National N-Viro Tech, Inc., and have ceased all work at the City of Toledo under the contract that was&#160;not renewed in 2011.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Current Developments</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We are currently in discussions with several companies in the cement and fuel/power generation industries for the development and commercialization of the patented N-Viro Fuel&#8482; technology.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that these discussions will be successful.&#160;&#160;We continue to focus on the development of regional biosolids processing facilities.&#160;&#160;Currently we are in negotiations with several privatization firms to permit and develop independent, regional facilities.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Securities and Exchange Commission</font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As a public company, we are required to file periodic reports, as well as other information, with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) within established deadlines.&#160;&#160;Any document we file with the SEC may be viewed or copied at the SEC&#8217;s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, N.E., Washington, D.C. 20549.&#160;&#160;Additional information regarding the Public Reference Room can be obtained by calling the SEC at (800) SEC-0330.&#160;&#160;Our SEC filings are also available to the public through the SEC&#8217;s web site located at www.sec.gov.</font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We maintain a corporate Web site at www.nviro.com, on which investors may access free of charge our annual report on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q and amendments to those reports as soon as is reasonably practicable after furnishing such material with the SEC.&#160;&#160;In addition, we will voluntarily provide electronic or paper copies of our filings free of charge upon request to James K. McHugh, our Chief Financial Officer, at (419) 535-6374 or via e-mail to jmchugh@nviro.com.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item 1A.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Risk Factors</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">We have a history of losses and there can be no assurances regarding if and when we will achieve profitability.&#160;&#160;If we are unable to achieve profitable operations, we may need to raise additional capital to continue our operations, which may not be available on commercially reasonable terms or at all, and which may dilute our stockholders.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Since 2000, we have experienced net losses and we have not been consistently profitable on an annual basis.&#160;&#160;For the years ended December 31, 2011 and 2010, we incurred net losses of $1.6 million and $3.0 million, respectively.&#160;&#160;We believe our history of net losses is primarily due to our inability to add enough new sources of revenue to replace decreasing business from existing sources of revenue and, more recently, through a shift of our business toward lower margin products and services.&#160;&#160;Further, for the years ended December 31, 2011 and 2010, we experienced much higher than expected expenditures for stock-related fees and compensation in excess of our increase in gross revenue.&#160;&#160;To achieve profitability, we must accomplish numerous objectives, including growth in our business, the development of new products and commercial relationships, and decreasing our costs.&#160;&#160;We can not foresee with any certainty whether we will be able to achieve these objectives in the future.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, we may not generate sufficient net revenue to achieve profitability.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Failure to maintain effective internal controls could have a material adverse effect on our business, operating results and stock price.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We have evaluated and will continue to evaluate our internal control procedures in order to satisfy the requirements of Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, which requires an annual management assessment of the design and effectiveness of our internal controls over financial reporting.&#160;&#160;We have previously identified a material weakness in our internal controls over financial reporting due to a lack of personnel to sufficiently monitor and process transactions.&#160;&#160;Due to our continuing lack of financial resources to hire and train accounting and financial personnel, we have not yet remedied this material weakness.&#160;&#160;At the beginning of 2012, as part of continued cost-cutting measures, we laid off one of our financial personnel that reported directly to the Chief Financial Officer.&#160;&#160;While we are not aware of any material errors to date, our inability to maintain the adequate internal controls may result in a material error in our financial statements.&#160;&#160;Moreover, effective internal controls, particularly those related to revenue recognition, are necessary for us to produce reliable financial reports and are important to helping prevent financial fraud.&#160;&#160;If we experience a material error in our financial statements or if we cannot provide reliable financial reports or prevent fraud, our business and operating results could be harmed, investors could lose confidence in our reported financial information, and the trading price of our stock could drop significantly.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Compliance with environmental laws and regulations may reduce, delay or prevent our realization of license revenues and/or facility revenue.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our operations and our licensees and their operations are subject to increasingly strict environmental laws and regulations, including laws and regulations governing the emission, discharge, disposal and transportation of certain substances and related odor.&#160;&#160;Wastewater treatment plants and other plants at which our biosolids products or processes may be implemented are usually required to have permits, registrations and/or approvals from state and/or local governments for the operation of such facilities.&#160;&#160;Some facilities using our processes require air, wastewater, storm water, biosolids processing, use or siting permits, registrations or approvals.&#160;&#160;These licensees may not be able to maintain or renew their current permits or registrations or to obtain new permits or registrations.&#160;&#160;The process of obtaining a required permit or registration can be lengthy and expensive.&#160;&#160;They may not be able to meet applicable regulatory or permit requirements, and therefore may be subject to related legal or judicial proceedings that could have a materially adverse effect on our income derived from these facilities.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Any of the permits, registrations or approvals noted above, or related applications may be subject to denial, revocation or modification, or challenge by a third party, under various circumstances.&#160;&#160;In addition, if new environmental legislation or regulations are enacted or existing legislation or regulations are amended or are enforced differently, these facilities may be required to obtain additional, or modify existing, operating permits, registrations or approvals.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -1.8pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Maintaining, modifying or renewing current permits or registrations or obtaining new permits or registrations after new environmental legislation or regulations are enacted or existing legislation or regulations are amended or enforced differently may be subject to public opposition or challenge.&#160;&#160;Much of this public opposition and challenge, as well as related complaints, relates to odor issues, even when a facility is operated in compliance with odor requirements and even though they have worked hard to minimize odor from their operations.&#160;&#160;Public misperceptions about the business and any related odor could influence the governmental process for issuing such permits or registrations or for responding to any such public opposition or challenge.&#160;&#160;Community groups could pressure local municipalities or state governments to implement laws and regulations which could increase our&#160;&#160;costs of their operations that in turn could have a material and adverse effect on our business and financial condition.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Our ability to grow our revenues and operations may be limited by competition.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We provide a variety of technology and services relating to the treatment of wastewater residuals.&#160;&#160;We are in direct and indirect competition with other businesses that provide some or all of the same services including regional residuals management companies and national and international water and wastewater operations/privatization companies, technology suppliers, municipal solid waste companies and farming operations.&#160;&#160;Many of these competitors are larger and have significantly greater capital resources.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We derive a substantial portion of our revenue from services provided under municipal contracts, and many of these are subject to competitive bidding.&#160;&#160;We also intend to bid on additional municipal contracts, however, and may not be the successful bidder.&#160;&#160;In addition, some of our contracts will expire in the future and those contracts may not be renewed or may be renewed on less attractive terms.&#160;&#160;In 2011, we experienced just this possibility with respect to existing contracts in Toledo, Ohio and Seminole County, Florida, both of which were not renewed albeit for different reasons.&#160;&#160;If we are not able to replace revenues from contracts lost through competitive bidding or from the renegotiation of existing contracts with other revenues within a reasonable time period, the lost revenue could have a material and adverse effect on our business, financial condition and results of operation.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Our customer contracts may be terminated prior to the expiration of their term.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>A substantial portion of our revenue is derived from services provided under contracts and agreements with existing licensees.&#160;&#160;Some of these contracts, especially those contracts with large municipalities, provide for termination of the contract by the customer after giving relative short notice (in some cases as little as ten days).&#160;&#160;In addition, some of these contracts contain liquidated damages clauses, which may or may not be enforceable in the event of early termination of the contracts.&#160;&#160;If one or more of these contracts are terminated prior to the expiration of its term, and we are not able to replace revenues from the terminated contract or receive liquidated damages pursuant to the terms of the contract, the lost revenue could have a material and adverse effect on our business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">A significant amount of our business comes from a limited number of customers and our revenue and profits could decrease significantly if we lost one or more of them as customers.&#160;&#160;Further, the agreement with our second largest customer expired in November 2011, and our failure to renew that agreement has, in the short-term, had a material adverse effect on our business, financial conditions and results of operations.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our business depends on providing services to a limited number of customers.&#160;&#160;One or more of these customers may stop contracting for services from us or may substantially reduce the amount of services we provide them.&#160;&#160;Any cancellation, deferral or significant reduction in the services we provide these principal customers or a significant number of smaller customers could seriously harm our business and financial condition.&#160;&#160;For the years ended December 31, 2011 and 2010, one of our largest customers accounted for approximately 17% and 22%, respectively, of our revenues and our top three customers accounted for approximately 55% and 60%, respectively, of our revenues.&#160;&#160;Our sludge processing agreement with the City of Toledo, Ohio, who was our largest customer for many years through 2010 and represented approximately 17% of our revenues in 2011, was not renewed at the end of 2011.&#160;&#160;Our failure to renew that agreement has had a material adverse effect on our business, financial conditions and results of operations.&#160;&#160;Also at the end of 2011, we were notified by a Florida customer, Seminole County, that represented gross revenue of $353,000 and $402,000 in 2011 and 2010, respectively, was terminating our services effective January 2012.&#160;&#160;This was approximately 6% and 8% of 2011 and 2010 gross revenue, respectively.&#160;&#160;Additionally, economic considerations have made the supply of admixtures used in our processes more difficult to acquire due to coal-burning facilities operating less or not at all.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">The current economic downturn may cause us to experience delays of payment from our customers.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our accounts receivable are derived primarily from municipal or local governments.&#160;&#160;Although our collection history has been good, from time to time a customer may not pay us on a timely basis because of adverse market conditions.&#160;&#160;In light of the current economic downturn, we may experience larger than expected delays in receiving payments on our accounts receivable.&#160;&#160;Given our history of losses and our limited cash resources, any significant payment delay by one of our customers, may force us to delay payment to our creditors, which may have a material and adverse effect on our business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">We are affected by unusually adverse weather conditions.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our present business is adversely affected by unusual weather conditions and unseasonably heavy rainfall which can temporarily reduce the availability of land application sites in close proximity to our operations.&#160;&#160;In addition, revenues and operational results are adversely affected during months of inclement weather which limits the amount of land application that can be performed.&#160;&#160;Long periods of adverse weather could have a material negative effect on our business and financial condition.&#160;&#160;For example, our Daytona Florida operation is sometimes affected by unusually adverse weather conditions by lowering the demand for N-Viro Soil<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(TM)</font> distribution to the local agricultural community.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fuel cost variation could adversely affect our operating results and expenses.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The price and supply of fuel is unpredictable and fluctuates based on events outside our control, including demand for oil and gas, actions by OPEC and other oil and gas producers, and war in oil producing countries.&#160;&#160;Because fuel is needed for the trucks that transport the processing materials and supplies for our operations and customers, price escalations or reductions in the supply of fuel could increase our operating expenses and have a negative impact on the results of operations.&#160;&#160;We are not always able to pass through all or part of the increased fuel costs due to the terms of certain customers' contracts and the inability to negotiate such pass through costs in a timely manner.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -2.15pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">We are highly dependent on the services of our management team, the loss of any of whom may have a material adverse effect on our business and financial condition.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
